subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Ransomware Kill Chain: From Infection to Payment
description: A quick win: understand The Ransomware Kill Chain: From Infection to Payment.

hook.text: Ransomware attacks follow a playbook: gain access, escalate privileges, disable backups, encrypt everything.

buildup.text: The kill chain starts with initial access (phishing or RDP), then spreads through the network over days or weeks.

discovery.text: Attackers deliberately destroy backup systems first. Without backups, victims have no choice but to negotiate.

twist.text: Ransomware costs exceeded $20B in 2021. The average downtime per attack is 22 days â€” devastating for any business.

climax.text: Each step in the kill chain is a chance to detect and stop the attack. Most organizations miss every opportunity.

punchline.text: 22 days of downtime. $20 billion in damages. Per year.

quiz.question: Why do ransomware attackers target backup systems first?
options: Destroying backups forces victims to pay since they can't recover data on their own
